        public CSV()

    • Method Detail

      • quoteText

        public static java.lang.String quoteText(java.lang.String s)
        Quotes a text string according to CSV rules (RFC 4180). Any input is allowed. The returned string is extended in length by at least 2 and starts and ends with '"' characters. The quoting occurs unconditional and no evaluation is performed whether quoting is required for the input.
        Parameters:
        s - String input text
        Returns:
        quoted text version or null if input was null

      • searchQuoteEnd

        public static int searchQuoteEnd(java.lang.String s,
                                 int start)
        Searches the quote end from a specified start position in a text string. Function returns the next index position in the input string after the first occurence of an unescaped quote character ('"'). If the end of string is reached, -1 is returned.
        Parameters:
        s - string to be investigated
        start - index in s to start search (must be greater zero - opening quote)
        Returns:
        index position after first valid end quote
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if start is zero or exceeds index range

      • unquoteText

        public static java.lang.String unquoteText(java.lang.String s)
        Unquotes a quoted text string according to CSV rules (RFC 4180). The input must be quoted in '"' characters, otherwise an exception is thrown.
        Parameters:
        s - input text
        Returns:
        unquoted text version or null if input was null
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if input is not quoted

      • encodeLine

        public static java.lang.String encodeLine(java.lang.String[] values,
                                          char separator)
        Creates a text string containing a series of CSV encoded String values which are given by the parameter String array. All string values are allowed. A null value in one of the array fields is equivalent to an empty string. The result may be seen as a valid CSV line but is not yet terminated by CRLF.

        Note: The rules of RFC-4180 are followed for construction. The following cases result in quoted fields: value contains one of {separator, double-quote ('"'), LF} or value starts or ends with a blank ("blank rule").

        Parameters:
        values - String array of the values to be encoded (not null)
        separator - the separator character between resulting field values (may not be one of ' ', '"', CR, LF)
        Returns:
        String of CSV encoded text fields
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if separator is illegal

      • decodeLine

        public static java.lang.String[] decodeLine(java.lang.String input,
                                            int start,
                                            char separator,
                                            Util.BufferInt endpos)
        Decodes a line of CSV encoded field values into an array of Strings. If input is an empty string, start parameter is ignored.
        Parameters:
        input - CSV encoded text (not null)
        start - offset in input to start interpretation
        separator - character used as field separator in text
        endpos - a BufferInt instance to receive output value; value indicates last-read position + 1 in input
        Returns:
        array of String values, each consisting of a decoded field
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if start is out of range or if separator is illegal

      • decodeLine

        public static java.lang.String[] decodeLine(java.lang.String input,
                                            int start,
                                            char separator)
        Decodes a line of CSV encoded field values into an array of Strings. If input is an empty string, start parameter is ignored.
        Parameters:
        input - CSV encoded text (not null)
        start - offset in input
        separator - character seen as field separator
        Returns:
        array of String values, each consisting of a decoded field
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if start is out of range or if separator is illegal
